docs.title: rich-gradient-cli
docs.text: rich-gradient-cli is a command-line interface for the rich-gradient library. It lets you render colorful gradients in terminal text, rules, panels, and markdown output.

docs.title: Quickstart
docs.text:
uv add rich-gradient-cli

gradient print --colors 'red,#ff9900,#ffff00' "This is gradient text that starts red, transitions through orange, and ends in yellow!"

docs.title: Why it exists
docs.text:
• Make terminal output easier to scan with color transitions
  • Render rich gradient panels and rules without custom code
  • Pipe and transform text or markdown from other CLI tools

docs.title: Commands at a glance
docs.text:
gradient print    Render gradient text
gradient rule     Render a gradient rule
gradient panel    Render a gradient panel
gradient markdown Render gradient markdown

docs.title: Examples
docs.text:
gradient rule --colors 'blue,#00ff00,cyan' "Blue to Green to Cyan Rule"

gradient panel --colors "red,#ff9999" -t "Error" --title-style "bold #ffffff" --title-align left 'This is an error message with a red to pink gradient background.'

echo "# Hello\n\n- This is **bold**.\n- This is *italic*." | gradient markdown -

docs.title: print
docs.text:
Render gradient text.

gradient print --colors 'red,#ff9900,#ffff00' "Hello gradient"
Option Description -c, --colors Comma-separated gradient colors. -r, --rainbow Use rainbow colors. -h, --hues Number of hues for a random gradient. --style Rich style string (non-color styles only). -j, --justify left, center, or right. --overflow crop, fold, or ellipsis. --no-wrap Disable wrapping. --end String appended after output. --bgcolors Comma-separated background colors. --svg Save output as SVG.

gradient rule --colors 'blue,#00ff00,cyan' "Blue to Green to Cyan Rule"

docs.title: Installation
docs.text:
uv add rich-gradient-cli

pip install rich-gradient-cli

docs.title: Basics
docs.text:
The CLI is installed as gradient.

gradient --help

The default command is print, so you can pass text directly.

gradient "Hello world"

docs.title: Reading from stdin
docs.text:
Any command that accepts text can read from stdin with -.

echo "Hello" | gradient print -

echo "# Title" | gradient markdown -

docs.title: SVG export
docs.text:
Use --svg to export a renderable to an SVG file.

gradient print "SVG output" --svg output.svg

gradient panel "Panel SVG" --svg panel.svg
